Some mercenaries are spending their time playing card games, drinking merrily or staring at the notice board for assignments to take as an individual or as part of a group.

A security guard approaches Raine and asks whether she carried any weapon on her person. She answers that she carries no weapon on her person before the security guard scans her with an omnitool and move on to the other person in her group.

The same thing happened when the security guard asked Tanya, but Ron has to handover all his weapon after he was scanned. The security guard thanked Ron once he is cleared and sealed the weapon before labeling it with Ron's name and dog tag ID, before putting it inside her secured office.

"No weapons allowed in the Guild office?"Asked Raine.

"Yep, some mercenaries are a rowdy bunch. Of course, most mercenaries are good, law-abiding members. It's just that some members are trigger happy and if they are drunk, high on drugs or depressed, it is a bad combination to have. Removing the temptation to use their weapons when they snap is just common sense, especially when the Guild office have young cadets around trying to learn from their seniors. Of course, fistfight still happens, and with regular occurrence but with mercenaries wearing dropsuits nobody will die from a typical bar fight now and then." Explained Ron.

"What about outside the Guild office?" Asked Raine again.

"Not to worry, we have flying drones stationed, ready to put down some rabid animals if they snap. Everybody gets to keep their weapons, and their safety is assured, everybody is happy. Of course, it's not feasible for the drone to operate indoors when there is a crowd, so they have to store their weapons and take it back when they exit the building. It is a procedure that has served the Caldari State well, for the past couple hundred years." Explained Ron again as he pointed towards the Guild office concierge for Tanya's orientation.

Raine nodded as their group moved on from the Guild office entrance and made a beeline towards the Guild, office concierge. Master Yu and Mi, followed from behind as Ron is capable of showing Tanya the ropes as a Garden graduate. Raine leads the way, and as she is halfway to the concierge, someone suddenly and deliberately blocked her way with their legs as she is about to pass their table.

‘Goodness, what an asshole.' Thought Raine with irritation as she glared at the slightly overweight and large mercenary sitting on the chair with his eyes closed and a smirk on his face, flanked with a pair of his goon friends with the same smirk on their faces.

In the face of disrespect, Raine forced her way through and kicked his legs away as she passes.

"Ouch! Hey now. That hurt!" Said the young man as he stands up and chases after Raine, blocking her way.

"What are you going to do about this? Huh" Said the young man before staring at Tanya longer, noticing Tanya's wearing an official Garden cadet uniform.

"Looks like my injuries need to be treated kindly by that women there." Said the young man again.

"Hehe..hehe…" Giggled Raine suddenly, attracting the attention of the young man in front of her again.

"No, no. Please forgive me. You spoke just like a stereotypical punk so I couldn't help laughing." Replied Raine mockingly.

"What did you say?!" Said the angered young man, as he brings his face closer to Raine to provoke her.

Raine punched the young man right at the center mass of his medium dropsuit armor variant with all her strength. The dropsuit armor cracked as the young man flew across the Garden office and crashed into the Garden office concierge, attracting the attention of the surrounding people and surprised a Guild attendant manning the concierge.

Raine was aiming to have him slide on the ground after the punch, but it cannot be helped as the angle could only result in him flying due to the difference of height between her and an adult man.

"Big brother!" Shouted his two goons as they stared at the prone body of their colleague slumped against the concierge.

BAR FIGHT SCENE - Battle OST: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rQg2qngyIZM

Raine meets the stares of the surrounding people unflinchingly while cracking both of her fists together.

"You will just do, I thank you for the opportunity. This is just what I need to let loose some steam. Come at me punks, if you dare!" Declared Raine as she can feel the heavy and negative emotion in her core spreads to her arm and limbs, pumping them for the coming fight.

Everyone silently stares at her, not knowing what to do. The silence did not last long however before some of the more hot-headed mercenaries got triggered by the prospect of a good fight.

"BAR FIGHT!" Shouted a mercenary before running towards Raine with fists raised.

The whole place gets noisy as some people run for the exits while some starts hammering the person next to them. Master Yu and Mi beat a hasty retreat, while Tanya is whisked away by Ron following the pair as well. Raine is left alone at the center of the chaos, blocking the triggered mercenary in front of her with both fists and knowledge of martial arts. Her martial arts are a mish-mash of techniques she learned as a man yet never completed due to disinterest. However, looks like it is enough to go toe to toe with this particular mercenary it seems.

Raine notices that the two goons of the first man she punched away start to run towards her, intent on taking revenge for their friend. Seems like she needs to take it up a notch, as she ducked under her opponent's round kick and countered by a mule kick her mercenary opponent's ass as he is facing away from her.

Raine feels that Copying Tanya's kick does feel good when done to someone else, as she sees her second opponent flies away and slide head first on the ground before colliding into another melee.

Raine then run towards the pair of goons before suddenly jumping and performing a flying lariat against the two goons. She runs while hitting their body with both her arms stretched as she passed in-between the two goons.

The two blasts off into space and crashed through the Guild office window, like a scene from an old western cowboy movie.

"I need more of this fight!" Said Raine as she could feel her heavy and negative emotion webs away from her core as it fuels her limbs for that extra strength and destructive power.

Raine joins other mercenaries melee, and with a swing of her arm, a mercenary discovers his/her penchant for flying. No one shows fear or hesitation when she strikes a homerun with another mercenary.

On the contrary, they get more excited at the prospect of beating Raine in a brawl. So much so that they all change their target to Raine alone, thirsty for the honor of being the one to bring Raine down in a fight. Dozens of people run towards her, and she managed to batter away one or two before they all dog-piled on Raine and starts hammering her with their limbs. The mass of human bodies then explodes outwards from the center as Raine burst from within the human dog-pile.

"Shoryuken!" Shouted Raine randomly as she performs a jumping uppercut from under the center mass of the human bodies.

Everyone in close contact with Raine's Shoryuken become disoriented from the violent impact and fainted, while the rest of the mercenaries jump in again for another chance to trade blows with her.

Being hit from all sides, Raine's HP is depleting but since her stats are much higher compared to the blow she received, only a quarter of her HP is reduced so far. These mercenaries are high on defense due to the dropsuit armor, but without their weapon, they are a brick house, the opposite of a glass cannon. At this rate, the security guards will come and break up the fight before she can finish enjoying the fight.

Raine wills her spirit to burn brightly, intending to squeeze that extra speed to beat up the surrounding mercenaries around her through force of will. Unconsciously, the heavy and negative emotion spread and burns her HP greedily. Not only that, under her uniform, dark veins spread and boosts her strength and speed attribute to their limit.

Before the surrounding mercenaries eyes, Raine blurred and disappeared before their world explodes in pain. With quick succession, the mercenaries are struck by something and flies away to crash some distance away. The mercenaries panicked as they did not expect the opponent to have a cloaking field even without wearing a dropsuit armor. They could only stare stupidly as one by one their number go down until no one is left fighting inside the Guild office building.

The spectator surrounding the melee stays silent, so amazed at the fight they have seen today, that they did not notice the sliding doors at the entrance to the Garden opens and closes by itself.

Raine is still on an adrenaline rush from the fight, yet she feels better as her heart became light. She is exhausted, and her HP is only half full because of it, but she could not say she regrets it as she has no intention applying as a mercenary anyway. Avoiding the attention of Tanya and Ron from the Garden common ground, outside the Guild office building, she returns to Master Yu's office to cool down more before meeting up with them again.

Hacking through Master Yu's locked door, she enters his office, and once she feels safe, she unconsciously phases out of being invisible.

Too tired to question where she gets this new ability, she dropped on the sofa and promptly passed out.

"Ms. Raine, it's time to wake up." Said someone as Raine could feel being nudged awake.

Raine opens her eyes and sees Kaidan in front of her, wearing an expression of curiosity and worry.

"Kaidan? Why are you here?" Asked Raine.

"What do you mean? Commander Iden asked me to meet you up here in Master Yu's office, I just arrived here, but someone told me that there was a commotion on the Guild office, so I became worried and came here straight looking for you." Answered Kaidan, looking at Raine's torn and worn uniform with suspicion.

"Alright, maybe I was involved, but I didn't start it." Pouted Raine.

"Sigh, fine at least I know nobody died. It should be easy enough to cover this up. I hope you realize that we would be missing out on the mech match at the colosseum since it's already this late." Complained Kaidan.

"What?! What time is it now?" Said Raine looking at the clock only to find the scorch mark and sheepishly look down to the ashes on the ground.

Raine hurriedly runs to the window behind Master Yu's office desk and proceed to stare outside with the intent to gauge the time of the day from the amount of daylight which can be seen.

"If we hurry, we can surely still make it!" Said Raine with stubbornness.

This scene was, however, before the window shatters into pieces as a hypervelocity bullet from a railgun tore into Raine's forehead and spilled black matter from the new hole at the back of her head.

"MS. RAINE!!!!" Screamed Kaidan, rushing forward with a hand stretched trying to catch Raine's falling body.

‘And the day is supposed to end with fun watching a mech match too…' Thought Raine as she is falling to the ground in slow motion.

chapters.name: INTERMISSION - GARDEN SHEET - GALBADIA GARDEN
chapters.content:
Galbadia Garden Symbol

THE GALBADIA GARDEN

Click here for Galbadia Garden Theme

A Garden in the Caldari State, located inside the Jita Trading hub station in the stronghold of humanity's territory.

The Galbadia Garden is considered the largest Garden among the four Gardens of the universe, due mostly to the clandestine and complicated funding scheme from the Caldari megacorp factions, 'The Practicals', 'The Liberals' and 'The Patriots'.

Unlike other Gardens, which attempts to maintain political independence, it is an open secret that Galbadia Garden enjoys close association with the Caldari State government and its military, the Caldari Navy.

Due to indirect State support and personnels, the Galbadia Garden's overall strength and power is considered a step above all other Gardens.

However due to the fractional nature of the power behind Galbadia Garden, it's strength is also fractured, as there are factions with conflicting interests managing it's administration from behind the scene.

The administrators of the Garden are also known as Master and they would throw their support behind one of the Caldari faction or the other.

Although, while some Master is publically known as a loyal supporter of only one faction, some would change allegiances at a drop of the hat should it suit their purpose or if doing so would benefit them.

Galbadia Garden's Headmaster, Martine, has recently setup a program to recruit Balamb graduates into the Galbadian Army, a fact known by the Caldari State Intelligence department. Widely known by the other Galbadia Garden Masters that the Headmaster action is prompted by Quistis Trepe, a Balamb Garden Instructor on diplomatic visit who spent a brief time at Galbadia Garden taking lessons.

This is unpopular with the majority of the Galbadia Garden Masters, as unlike Balamb Garden, Galbadia Garden does not train SeedS who specialises in mentally linking with combat drones, but instead focuses on advancing weapon technology and as a military academy for the Caldari State. The Galbadian installation focuses its training program on technological aspects of combat rather than forming a mental link with combat drones, and is the only Garden where training for all races weapon systems are available such as Projectile Autoguns, Laser Rifles, Hybrid Railguns and Hybrid Blaster as part of their education curiculum.

LAYOUT

Galbadia Garden's layout is more enclosed than other Gardens, and it's the only Garden which have an oceanarium inside it's structure. Although it retains the basic circular design surrounding a central lobby, main sections are reached by enclosed hallways running around the perimeter rather than accessed through open-air corridors extending out from the center. It has two main floors accessible by stairwells, plus a Headmaster's suite on the third story reached via a special elevator. The first and second floors are accessible to the entire Garden population, while the third floor requires key card access to the elevator.

Ground floor:

Oceanarium

The Oceanarium is the pride of the Galbadia Garden, built to house tens of thousands of native Earth oceanic species and maintain them. The oceanarium is temperature regulated, oxygenated and artificial currents are generated to create a livable ecosystem for the viewing pleasure of guests of the Galbadia Garden and to show the prosperity of humanity and by extension the Caldari State as a whole.

Front gate

The front gate is the main entrance to the Garden. Upon entering the outer part of the gate, visitors travel down a large paved walkway before proceeding to a security checkpoint at the inner gate. SparkS, students, and visitors must present their IDs for inspection to pass and enter the Garden.

Lobby

The front gate entrance leads to the lobby. The only access to the rest of the Garden, the lobby is guarded by a powerful battlemech codenamed 'Cerberus' who stands watch on a small risen platform at the lobby's center.

NOTE: SPEC & WEAPONRY CLASSIFIED TO SECURITY PASS LEVEL 3 AND BELOW.

Classrooms

The classrooms are located off various corridors on the first floor, arranged lecture-hall style with desks leading down a slope to a teacher's podium at the bottom. Students are obliged to be present in classes five minutes before the bell rings.

Library

Following the lobby to the right, the southeastern corridor branching off from the ring leads to the Galbadia Garden library. Open from 9am until curfew, its materials are available to students.

Training Center

Continuing up the lobby ring counter-clockwise, the eastern corridor leads to the training center. Known by students as the "monsters' lair," it is open 24 hours a day, even after curfew. Monsters inhabit it, mainly Bite Bugs, Grats and Tri-Face to challenge students' fighting skills.

Grat

A plantoid species bigger than a man and able to move by utilizing it's roots. A Grat's body is mostly a digestive bag filled with digestive juice and acid, it then digests enemies after catching them with its vine. A Grat also uses gas attack that causes Sleep. The Grat sometimes prey on a lone Bite Bug but often gets overwhelmed when swarmed instead. The top predator, Tri-Face left this monster alone as it does not consider Grat as it's food, yet a Grat would scavenge and leave it's seed on dead Bite Bugs and Tri-Face for the next generation to grow and emerge.

Bite Bug

A flying bug monster that flies and biting with it's oversized pincers as it's only weapon, it often utilizes swarm tactics as well. When swarmed, students should stay calm, aim and shoot precisely. A solitary Bite Bug is not a very strong enemy and serve as food for the predatory Tri-Face which is the top predator inside the Training Facility. Bite Bug preys on the plantoid monster Grat.

Tri-Face

The top predator of the Galbadia training garden, it is a monster with 3 heads. The 2 heads on the side are not real, but they bite and spit poison gas and acid as if they were. Mainly prey on Bite Bugs inside the training facility, engage with caution as it's claws and teeths are strong enough to pierce through even dropsuit armor plating.

Fieldhouse

The fieldhouse is located off the northern corridor, and is home to a large indoor track as well as what appear to be tennis and basketball courts, reflecting Galbadia Garden's love of sports.

\

Skating rink and locker room

The skating rink is located off the eastern corridor, and sports a large ice arena for the Garden's hockey and skating teams to practice and compete. A locker room is attached for cadets to change and store their equipment.

Cafeteria

The northwest corridor leads to the cafeteria. The cafeteria is open from 9am till 9pm, and students can order meals for the night and pick them up before curfew. The most popular dish is the fish and protein chips. The cafeteria is a popular hang-out spot for cadets to meet and exchange gossip. The Garden's Disciplinary Commitee is often found here.

Quad

The western corridor leads to the quad, an open-air garden and a place for students to relax. It has a stage where students can watch performances or films. The annual Garden Festival takes place in the quad.

Upper floors:

Unauthorized usage: this narrative is on Amazon without the author's consent. Report any sightings.

Dormitory

Dormitories are located off of various corridors on the second floor. Galbadian cadets bunk four to a room, which will form a dedicated squad as they bond during the course of their training. One wall is lined with individual sleeping berths, while the opposite wall contains four desks with computer terminals and rolling chairs.

Reception room

The reception room is a parlor located off the northern corridor on the second floor. Here, visiting dignitaries and other guests wait prior to meeting with the Headmaster.

Auditorium

The auditorium is a large arena located off the southern corridor on the second floor. Stadium seats surround a large elevated podium at the front, and large video screens hang on either side. The auditorium is generally used for Garden assemblies and as a forum for guest speakers, although the location may also cater to entertainment-related events.

Infirmary

The southwest corridor leads to the infirmary where medical personnels takes care of sick or injured students. No items can be taken from the infirmary without the doctor's permission.

Headmaster's office

The headmaster's office is located on the third floor, accessible by those with the clearance to activate a special elevator on the second floor near the reception room. Students may only visit the office when summoned by Headmaster Martine.

RULES AND REGULATIONS FOR GALBADIA GARDEN FACILITIES

Classroom

-Students should be in their seats and waiting for the instructor 5 minutes before class.
-When class is over, proceed quietly to your next class.
-Food, weapons and porns are prohibited.
-Study panels are shared. Handle with care.

Training Center

-Proceed with caution. There are real monsters in the training center.
-It is open 24 hours. Entering the ground for reasons other than training is prohibited.
-Do not engage in battles beyond your abilities.

Infirmary

-Visit the infirmary if you have any health concerns or problems.
-No items may be taken from the infirmary without permission.
-Follow the doctors instructions.

Library

-Open Hours: 9.00 am - lights out.
-Library usage: All materials are open to public. You may check-out materials at the desk.
-Remain quiet at all times.

Dormitory

-Everybody is welcome to apply.
-SparkS have priority for single rooms.
-Going out after hours for reasons other than training is prohibited.
-Do not leave personal possessions in common areas.

Cafeteria

-Open Hours: 9.00 am - 9.00 pm.
-Keep the area clean.
-If late-night meals are required, order them before hand.

Galbadia Garden Student Cadets rules

Garden Precepts

Work hard. Study hard. Play hard.

Attire

In general, there is no dress-code in Galbadia Garden. However, dress accordingly if instructed to do so by your superiors.

Reward and Punishment

-The Headmaster presents official commendations to outstanding students.
-Students who engage in violent acts, sexual promiscuity, or who fall behind in their curriculum, etc. may be expelled from Garden.

Conduct

-The skills acquired in Garden must never be used for personal gain.
-Refrain from committing acts that may damage the Garden's reputation.
-Take time to think things through before starting a relationship.

Procedures in case of an emergency

-If you are on 2f, use the emergency exit next to the classroom. If you are on 1F, exit through front gate. All students must take care of junior classmen during emergencies.
-Do not use the elevator during an emergency.

Evening Outings

All students should be in their dorm rooms before after-hours unless at the training center.

Admission and graduation

Admission

-Applicants between ages 5-15 are admitted.
-All hardworking and confident youths are welcome.
-Ambitious overachievers are also welcome.
-Applicants are admitted only after passing a final interview.

Graduation

-Must be between 15-19 years of age.
-One must have all the required skills and knowledge taught through Garden courses.
-One must have the Headmaster's approval to graduate.
-At age 20, regardless of graduation, all students are released from the Garden either as a mercenary or joining the Caldari Navy as naval infantry onboard combat space vessels.

Opportunities for Alumni

-The Garden supports a program that helps graduates enlist in armies across worlds.
-Instructors and SparkS are permitted to remain at the Garden. However, SparkSship must be attained before the age of 20.

UNISEX Galbadia Garden Students Uniform

Gardens require students to wear cadet uniforms for formal occasions or external operations where the Garden is represented. The Garden logo appears partway down the right sleeve. All gears must be maintained by each students and it will be passed down to younger students upon graduation. Upon graduation, students that become Mercenary would receive stipend from the Garden and are expected to source their own gears and weaponry of choice. Loan from the Garden are available for Mercenaries upon graduation. Students who fail to become mercenaries are expected to join the Caldari Navy as pary of naval infantry serving on combat space vessels or as guards for civilians area and civilian space vessels.

Galbadia Garden Students Armaments

As part of the training curriculum, Galbadia Garden cadets are expected to familiarize themselves with all the races basic weaponry or gear and combat practices. More often than not, in the field of battle, cadets may have to salvage or hijack weapons or armors of enemies. Which is why basic knowledge of the enemy's weapons, gears and tactics are essential for the Galbadia Garden student cadets. The education of the standard Galbadia Garden student cadets may cover how to use, disassemble and maintain Projectile Autoguns, Laser Rifles, Hybrid Railguns and Hybrid Blaster.

Specialised Galbadia Garden Student Course

An outstanding performer among the student cadets may choose to further their education by specializing their combat role on the field. After the students have covered their basic training, an intructor may decide to put them in a smaller class with a more personal attention from a more senior instructor. The path available for an outstanding Galbadia Garden student cadets are Scout, Sniper, Shocktrooper, Engineer, Medic, Tech Specialist, Pilot and Paratrooper.

Scout: Student cadets specialising in fast assault and recon using hover bikes.

Sniper: Student cadets specialising in dealing heavy damage from a distance using a railgun sniper rifle.

Shocktrooper: Student cadets specialising in heavy armor and shield protection alongside their standard assault rifle of their choice.

Engineer: Student cadets specialising in explosive and demolition, as well as driving and maintaining combat vehicles and engines.

Medic: Student cadets specialising in treating combat wounds as well as cultivating and applying medigels to the injured.

Tech Specialist: Student cadets specialising in operating and maintaining Caldari combat drones and droid as well as hacking enemy electronic installation and safeguarding the HQ communication network.

Pilot: Student cadets specialising in operating atmospheric fighters or atmospheric insertion aerial vehicles.

Paratrooper: Student cadets specialising in search and destroy or search and rescue operation using aerial combat platforms.

Galbadia Garden Light Armored Vehicle:

Note: A Scout operating their hover bikes performing an aerial formation. The main armament of the hover bike are the assault autoguns installed in the front section of the hover bikes.

Note: A Paratrooper operating their aerial combat platform. The main armament of the aerial combat platform are the pair of triple-barrel linked gatling guns and micro missiles.

Galbadia Garden Heavy Armored Vehicle:

BGH251F2, also known as Iron Clad, for cases where heavier firepower are needed the above armored vehicles come into the scene. Driven by an Engineer, the six Dynamo drives lining both sides of the armored vehicles directing intense electric voltage to operate the central main railcannon. The firepower and effective range of this vehicle once a target is locked and the cannon charged is beyond question. The BGH251F2 is the bane of bunker and static defence employed by the enemy, best deployed at a range where the enemy are outranged and supported by aerial combat platforms and fighters.

Galbadia Garden Aerial Atmospheric Insertion Vehicle:

A Caldari Aerial Atmospheric Insertion Vehicle operated by a Pilot discharging it's passengers for an assault. Equipped with a heavy shield generator and a pair of twin linked rail guns for defense.

Galbadia Garden  Atmospheric Fighter:

A Caldari Atmospheric Fighter operated by a Pilot for aerial dogfighting against enemy fighters. Equipped with a shield generator, heavy Gattling Railguns, chaffs, heavy missile and micro missiles

Galbadia Garden Droids:

GIM52A, an aerial flight enabled Galbadia Garden droid that attacks with nova blades and micro missiles. The more advanced models use high-powered laser beams from it's torso. When used in conjuction with the combat aerial platform piloted by a paratrooper, it become a lethal combination. Two Squadrons of this type of droids are stationed within the Galbadia Garden quarters.

K-TRON CALDARI SUPER BATTLE DROID

K-TRON Caldari Super Battle Droid, built in response to the Gallente Federation B2 Super Battle Droid. Sparing no expense, The Caldari State commisioned the K-TRON series droid to even the playing field. What came out from the Lai Dai research labs is a droid unit which is superior in every way compared to the Gallente Federation B2 Super Battle Droid. Unfortunately, the cost of manufacturing them are also superior compared to the B2 Super Battle Droid as it is prohibitively expensive to manufacture the K-TRON series of droids. The K-TRON series droids are deemed unfeasible to deploy in the battlefield en-masse, therefore the K-TRON series droids are deployed as ever-vigilant guards in high security installations as a sentinels devoid of human weakness and fatigue. Perfecly compatible with all races weaponry and programmed to serve humanity interest first and foremost, a squad of this droid type are stationed around Galbadia Garden.

K-TRON CALDARI HEAVY GUNNER SUPER BATTLE DROID

K-TRON Caldari Heavy Gunner Super Battle Droid, contrary to regular K-TRON droid which serves as Guards. A K-TRON Caldari Heavy Gunner Super Battle Droid are built and outfitted for total destruction of the enemy and it's armored assets. At a cost of double a standard K-TRON unit. it is built as a Vanguard for combat operation which could not be allowed to fail. This K-TRON unit type have eliminated a whole battalion of orcs pirate raider by itself when deployed in a combat theatre. Programmed for the most efficient elimination of enemy combatants and the most advanced Caldari aiming algorithms program, it is equipped with a drum type Gattling Heavy Railgun. Should the unit deplete it's ammo, it is also programmed with a thousand years of humanity's martial arts history to kill with it's limbs, leaving broken bodies and a hole in their heart in it's wake. Only one unit of this K-TRON super battle droid type is available within the Galbadia Garden.

chapters.name: Chapter 17
chapters.content:
His name is Irvine Kinneas…

An advanced student cadet of Galbadia Garden and one of it’s most skilled Sniper in its history of operation.

As a state orphan, Irvine was one of the lucky one sent to the Garden program at age ten. Since then, he has climbed his way to the top rank with sheer grit, persistence, sweat, tears, and blood.

Every single day he woke up at dawn, run laps and do push up to shape his body towards perfection. He treats his weapons like his limb and maintains it so many time that he could disassemble and reassemble any firearm with his eyes closed.

The downside to Irvine’s single-minded determination to reach the top was his isolation from his fellow student cadet members, and before he realizes it, he became a loner without friends. That is not to say that he is without social contacts, as admirers and underclassmen start to approach him for advice and guidance.

At first, he is at a loss on how to teach his underclassmen what he has learned, but with time found the experience therapeutic and relaxing enough that he found himself enjoying it, which leads to more widespread popularity among his younger peers.

Another unexpected effect of Irvine’s desire for perfection and reaching the top rank in the Garden is his increase in attractiveness to members of the opposite sex, and it helps that his facial feature is considered to be one of the most handsome among men in the whole Garden.

From what he had heard, he is already considered one of the divas of the Garden.

Some girls even printed out his poster in their dorms.

Although for the life of him, he could not understand why they need to print a life-size poster of him during his swimming sessions and place it on the ceiling above their bed.

The lifestyle of girls are a mystery to him, and he considers this as one of those unsolved life mysteries barred to men, just as when he starts finding wet girls underwear inside his classroom desk.

The numbers of men in the Garden is low to begin with, and if you combine the fact with his status as one of the top rank student cadets in the Garden, then no wonder he starts receiving dating offers as well as gifts of admiration and appreciation.

It is a very flattering and addicting experience, receiving all this attention from members of the opposite sex and he might let too much of the love and adoration into his head.

Irvine already considers it normal to accept a dinner invitation from beautiful women every night, ever since a woman insists that she foot the whole bill. Although to be fair, he offered tuition at her place for a while in return.

The first person who asks her for a dinner date is a lovely and fit woman, and he might be a bit smitten with her, so he agrees. That was his first mistake, and his second mistake was when he accepts the invitation for coitus.

Ever since then, every girl in the Garden has the impression that they could have a taste of him as long as they buy him dinner and give gifts first.

Irvine could refuse, he really could, but at this point, it’s already water under the bridge and his reputation as being easy already set in stone. At that point, men start avoiding him, hurling insults like man-whore and belittle his innocence, purity, and worth as a man. He might turn to alcohol for a while because of that, but he managed to climb back up from depression and decided to embrace his new situation as a means to improve his lot in life.

The ‘gifts’ he received from women are gathered, and he put in savings with the intention to buy the most advanced light drop suit armor available in the Garden armory, the ‘Dragonfly’ Scout drop suit armor. The Dragonfly is a suit designed to adapt and conform to an individual’s usage patterns, learning and eventually predicting actions before they occur, substantially increasing response times and maneuverability. The suit is imported from the Gallente Federation Balamb Garden through the Headmaster personal connection.

When he first saw the drop suit armor displayed in the armory, he fell in love with it. That is until he saw the price and left thinking it was only a pipedream. Now with his additional income, he believes that pipe dream would soon turn into reality.

And after months of backbreaking, dirty work, resulting in getting slightly overweight due to accepting dinner invitation every night and skipping his physical practices, he could finally buy his dream drop suit armor and leave behind the sordid industry forever.

The moment he parted with his credits and receive the drop suit armor was one of the happiest in his life. He was so joyful with his purchase that he decided to wear it immediately and contact some of his underclassmen for a drink of beer in the Guild office to celebrate.

That day then became his happiest and saddest day of his life.

After a few jugs of beers, he noticed a small girl wearing one of those fancy dryad leaves wig made by Lai Dai from the holovision advertisement, cutting through the bar towards the Guild office concierge.

He first became concerned that such a young girl would apply for a job at the Mercenary Guild office, and then shock as one of the Garden administrators, Master Yu seems to be part of her entourage.

He does not understand why Master Yu is there with her but then became convinced that she is ignorant or are being misled about the danger of a mercenary job. He then resolved himself to dissuade her from her current path by blocking her way using his legs.

However, to his shock, the little girl kicked away his legs forcefully and passed through with her companions in tow, leaving him behind. With irritation he took a stand from his seat and chased after the little girl, confronting her directly before realizing that one of her companions is also a little girl around the same age as the one wearing the fancy Dryad leaves wig.

Changing tactic, he falsely asks for medical assistance as a cover to bring them to a quieter place to enlighten their group the danger of introducing a mercenary life to such a young girl in the medical ward. However, he did not expect the little girl in the fancy Dryad leaves wig to insult his concern with such cruelty.

In fact, he did not expect to receive a blow from her in such strength even more. The moment the little girl fist strikes his torso, he felt as if a truck just crashed to him, and his body soared through the air and ended with him blacking out when he landed head first on the Guild office concierge.

By the time he came about, he wakes up to a scene of devastation. His fellow student cadets and even more senior mercenaries are injured and are being attended to by a medical personnel. All of them are incapacitated after receiving what seems to be a monstrous hit on their drop suit armor.

Looking down on his torso, he laments the crack and indentation of the dropsuit armor he just bought with his hard earned savings. With a start, he rises and starts to look for his underclassmen with difficulty as his chest is in pain and with a mild headache. Eventually, he found both of his underclassmen. His two underclassmen are unconscious and diagnosed by the medical personnel to have difficulty breathing due to the damage to their windpipe, as well as suffering from cuts and bruises because of crashing through the Guild office window.

With rage, he demanded to know the location of the culprit who causes all this mess and injury. Only to be answered by the medical personnel that she could not be found and that no one knows who she is.

As he became disgusted by their response, he left his underclassmen under the medical personnel's care and with haste return to his quarters in the dormitory.

Not bothering to change his newly bought and damaged drop suit armor, he took out his beloved Railgun Sniper Rifle from his locker and chambered live ammunition into it before leaving it on his bed.

After that, he took some explosives from his locker, in the form of grenades and claymore mines, before he secures the grenades to his waist belt and strapping the claymore mines to both sides of his thighs.

He then took out his Caldari Nova knife from his locker, a basic civilian model, and sheathed it on his waist. Finally, he took his urban camouflage cloak from the locker and wore it. The urban camouflage cloak reached all the way to his ankle and split open from the middle so he could reach out from the inside of the cloak from there. He then reaches for his Railgun Sniper Rifle on his bed, before he paused.

He has fear and some doubt on what he is about to do, and there is no guarantee that the culprit would still be in the Garden. However, remembering the condition of his underclassmen, seniors and the state of the Guild office, he steeled his resolve and grasped his Railgun Sniper Rifle firmly before concealing it under his urban camouflage cloak.

After having all his gears, he took a deep breath and released it, erasing the tension and doubt that he has. With haste, he exits his quarter and left the dormitory. No one challenges him on the way as no one beside his two unconscious underclassmen are aware of who owns that particular ‘Dragonfly’ drop suit armor.

Furthermore, his fellow student cadets assume that he is a senior mercenary with business in the Garden from the drop suit armor he wore and the confident gait in his steps as he walks.

He has a destination in mind, and that is the clock tower behind Master Yu’s office. He have been in Master Yu office before to discuss how best to advise and teach some of his younger underclassmen. He always noted how convenient it is that the clock tower position is directly behind Master Yu, so he could be aware of the flow of time spent inside Master Yu’s office no matter where he looks.

There is no certain chance that the culprit will be in Master Yu’s office or if she would return if she is no longer there. However, on the off-chance that she does return, he should not miss his chance to even the score.

As he skulks around the perimeter, he keeps in mind the location of the surveillance system and using all his accumulated knowledge and trained skills as a sniper to avoid and hack into them. By the time he reached the entrance to the clock tower, he is certain that the surveillance system did not manage to detect him even once.

It’s unfortunate that he has to employ the knowledge and skills given to him by Garden to circumvent the Garden’s security and surveillance system, but it could not be helped in this case as he hacked the locking mechanism of the clock tower and enters it.

Looking around, he noted the decrepit condition of the tower and spotted the ladder to go up towards the clock. He strapped his Railgun Sniper Rifle on his back and started climbing to the top.

After a while climbing up, he finally reached the top which leads to a narrow hallway where the maintenance hatch that leads outside is located. He then opens it before he immediately set up a gunner nest right next to the open hatch. With the strong wind flapping his urban camouflage cloak about he spotted the window which leads to the interior of Master Yu’s office.

Once confirming the potential target location, he settles down and prepares the Railgun Sniper Rifle so that it aims towards the window of Master Yu office and extend the tripod leg until it’s position become stable enough for him to let go of the weapon. He then activates the Railgun power setting, flooding the internal rifling chamber with unimaginable electric voltage to fire the piece of solid tungsten at hypersonic speed the moment he pressed the trigger. A soft humming sound from the weapon soothes his frazzled mind and which has always shaped his focus during weapon training.

He could have set up so the weapon will auto-fire when a moving target is in it’s targeting reticule. However, he could not do that in this case as that setting cannot differentiate between friend and foe. Therefore he would regret it if an innocent is fired upon by mistake.

Once satisfied, he stands up and left his weapon behind, and he then approaches the location where the ladder is located again to set up the claymore mines he brought with him and attach it to both sides of the narrow hallway.

He nods with satisfaction when the claymore mines beep and register himself as friendly before the mines turn passive. These particular claymore mines cost him a pretty penny because of the friend or foe sensor and ability to register fast approaching target while being fast enough to quickly react and detonate when the target is inside the ideal kill zone.

He returns to his gunner nest and confirms through the scope that the barrel is still aiming at Master Yu’s window and proceed to lay down on his stomach just staring at the window.

His slowed his breathing and slip into a trance as he remain vaguely alert for any change that happens within the confines of that room in his sights. In this state, he did not realize the passage of time as minutes, and hours could pass while staring at the window hoping for the target to show a glimpse of herself.

However, he did realize when the light is getting dimmer as the station is transitioning into its night cycle. Even though there is still no sign of the target, he still patiently waits for that one split second chance as being taught by the sniper instructor of the Garden.

His patience is rewarded when suddenly the face of his target encompass his whole sight, superimposed on his targeting reticule. As time slows to a crawl, he could feel his heartbeat beats loudly in his chest as his adrenaline spiked suddenly and his brain process increased exponentially. In this state, there is no capacity for higher thought or critical thinking, just pure reactionary measure drilled into him through persistent training.

Without realizing it, he aimed the targeting reticule at the center of her forehead before triggering his Sniper Rifle. And with a loud boom of hypersonic acceleration, the Railgun Sniper Rifle spits out a solid piece of tungsten at hypersonic velocity. He could see the moment the piece of bullet break the window and went through his target forehead. He is surprised that the force of the bullet did not make his target’s head explode as that should be the case based on what his instructor have said. However, it did throwback her head violently as she went down to the floor.

With his target without a doubt dead and retribution became his, everything returns to normal speed as he came out of the zone of his brain that allows him to process everything at light speed.

He could not relax yet though as the security drones of the Garden would have no doubt register the sound of a weapon discharge and are, at this moment, converging to his location to eliminate a security threat to the Garden.

With haste, he closes the hatch in front of him, and proceed to quickly grab his Railgun Sniper Rifle before rushing through the narrow hallway behind him. He approaches the pair of claymore mines that he has already prepared beforehand as it registers his movement before regarding him as a friendly, which allow him to leave the pair of claymore mines behind.

When he reached the ladder to go to ground level, he uses all his limbs to hold the handlebar of the ladder before weakening his grip so he could slide down quickly to ground level. The moment his feet touched the ground, he could hear the sound of commotion and explosion from above him.

No doubt the security drones have calculated the trajectory of the broken window and analyze that the source of the weapon fire likely came from within the clock tower. He could imagine the security drones blasting open the hatch to gain entry and are now filling the narrow hallway above him looking for a target.

He ignores all the commotion and calmly walked out of the clock tower, a second later the whole top section of the clock tower explodes violently in a blaze of fire and debris. He did not look back at the exploding tower as his instructor teaches him not to look back or it will ruin his helmet night vision capability. Personally, he just follows it because it made him look cooler, as he continues walking towards the direction of his dormitory quarter.

However, for some reason, he could feel someone’s attention on him from behind. Curious, he turns around and looks at the direction of Master Yu’s office window. There he could see a mercenary glaring at him from the window ledge. Feeling cheeky, he formed an aiming motion with his right hand and raised it up as if it shoots bullet towards his direction.

He does this while knowing that the mercenary could not do anything that will attract the attention of additional security drones converging on site from a location further away.

He then turns his back on the mercenary before walking away while playfully waving as he steps forward. He then activates the cloaking device of his ‘Dragonfly’ light scout suite to disappear and become entirely invisible. He did not activate the cloaking device earlier when he is on the way to the clock tower because he wants to conserve the power level of the suit for the escape attempt after the deed is done.

The journey back to his dormitory quarter was troublesome if uneventful as there are security personnel, droids and drones swarming the place after the clock tower explosion.

However, his ranking as the top Sniper student cadet was not for show as he avoided them all while hacking through the sealed corridor of the dormitory.

He slipped through the worried student cadets congregating around the dormitory holovision, as the image of the headmaster trying to reassure students and staffs that everything is under control and that their safety is assured.

The source of the Headmaster confidence seems to be since he has already activated the ‘Cerberus’ battlemech located at the center of the lobby and security droids and drones are patrolling the Garden ground looking for the attacker or any suspicious character.

When he finally reached the safety of his quarter, he could finally relax as he deactivated his cloaking device and dropped his Railgun Sniper Rifle on his bed. He would dearly like to take a shower before bed, so he took off all his drop suit armor and gear and stored them inside his locker.

He is also thankful for being a top student cadet in the Garden, as it gives a whole room with amenities for his personal use. He then enters the shower cubicle after taking off everything.

As he turns on the hot water knob and the flow of hot water washes over his form and relaxes his tense muscle, he finally feels that everything is right with the world.

Even though there are commotion and distress in the Garden now because of his action, he is not worried. In the morning, when they realize that no one from the Garden is hurt then this whole thing will blow over, and he could return to his regular life schedule as a top student cadet Sniper of the Garden.

chapters.name: Chapter 18
chapters.content:
Raine never realizes how the lighting system of the future works. It seems that there are these tiny holes from the ceiling that disperse the light equally well over a wide area.

Furthermore, the light is so soft and comfortable to the eyes, as if it’s a chemically induced fluorescence instead of light being generated by conventional heat like she is used to from her time. She wonders if they harvest the skin of squids and cuttlefish from the deep ocean and somehow glued it to the ceiling in the future.

Nonsensical thoughts are somehow floating inside Raine’s mind, but she can’t fault herself as she did just GOT SHOT THROUGH THE HEAD!

“I am so going to kill the bastard who shot me through the head…” Said Raine with venom before her view is filled with Kaidan’s faceplate.

“Ms. Raine! Are you okay?” Said Kaidan with panic over Raine’s prone body.

“Do you always ask that question when someone got shot in the head?” Replied Raine sarcastically as she shoved Kaidan’s faceplate away and got up from the floor before dusting off the broken window glass she was blasted with earlier.

“Not usually no, but this is you we are talking about. And I did saw you cut open your stomach to suck a giant frickin slime that was about to kill us yesterday.” Answered Kaidan sheepishly as he backed away from Raine.

“Touche, anyway give me that mirror on Master Yu’s desk. I want to see the damage the bastard did to my face. But before I did, tell me honestly. Do I still look pretty?” Asked Raine as she looks at Kaidan expectantly.

“No offense Ms. Raine, but you look horrifying. I can see the bookcase behind you through your head. I honestly have no idea how you are still functioning and are talking to me currently.” Answered Kaidan with uncertainty while he rubbed the back of his helmet.

“MOTHER…” Cursed Raine before something threatened to make whatever it is equivalent to a heart jumped out of her chest.

KABOOOOMMMM!

“FUCK!!!” Said Raine before she held her mouth with both of her hands in horror.

In response, Kaidan acted like the veteran he is and decided to quickly take cover beside the window the moment he heard the loud explosion before slowly peeking out from the windowsill side. He spotted the clock tower across from him, in ruins and burning fiercely. Although, this paled in comparison when he spotted someone that made him pause.

In all his years, Kaidan never thought to see one of the Gallente Federation Elves Commando brazenly infiltrating the Galbadia Garden and attempted assassination as well as executing a terrorist activity on their turf. He has to revise his opinion of the long-haired, pasty, self-righteous, pompous assholes.

Once again Kaidan has to emphasize that he never thought that they would have the balls to do so, as he stands at the center of the window to glare at the figure stepping away from the burning clock tower.

The figure in question is equipped with a Balamb Garden “Dragonfly’ Light Scout drop suit armor, normally worn by members of elite Balamb Garden SeeD Mercenary. Kaidan would like to believe that his glare and hatred reached this figure as the figure turned around and stared straight at him.

Kaidan’s rage spiked when the figure provoked him by motioning its hand as if it’s shooting him and then turning it’s back on him before engaging it’s cloaking device. Although not before parting the last shot by waving his hand as the figure continued to walk away even as it disappears with a cloaking device.

“Damned elves, I’d recognize that armor anywhere. I’d never thought I’d see one within Galbadia Garden. Have our security measures fallen that low that we could let pass an unidentified elf into the Garden interior?” Said Kaidan as he gritted his teeth in irritation.

Raine ignores Kaidan’s rambling as she let go of her mouth and approach Master Yu’s desk to take the handheld mirror. She raised the handheld mirror to her face level to see the damage.

Unfortunately, Raine became assaulted with a deep chill, as she really could see the other side of her head through the mirror, yet it is not healing or closing, and she still feels fine. She has a complicated feeling when she considers that inside her head turns out to be filled with black soil instead of grey matter.

Would it made Raine literally have a dirty mind? However, since she is still alive and well, she supposes she could appreciate the convenience of not having to worry about a headshot in the future from now on.

A dryad’s body could be so mysterious, having leaves as hairs, barks as the skin on her limbs, breathing through her leaves, having no brain or heart, having tentacle coming out of the back of her hand to feed, and breasts as practically a camel’s hump. She wonder what else would she found out about her body in the future and whether she should try spanking the monkey soon?

“Forget about that elf Kaidan, more importantly, could you go meet up with Ron and the others? I would like to hide this damn hole in my head by wearing my gear again. So go ask them to pick up my gear before you ask them to meet up here.” Said Raine as she complains from Master Yu’s desk while looking at her forehead with the aforementioned handheld mirror.

“But Ms. Raine! This incident is a serious matter! Don’t you realize that having one of the Gallente Federation Commandos attacking the Galbadia Garden is a serious diplomatic issue?” Replied Kaidan hotly as he turns to reply to Raine’s request.

“Ladida. Hello! I am talking here literally with a hole in my head! Don’t talk to me about priority when I have a hole on my mind! Besides, either you help me clean up this place or look for Ron and the others! Your Choice!” Shouted Raine fiercely as she dropped the handheld mirror and glared at Kaidan.

“If you think that I would leave you alone after what just happen to you, you have another thing coming young lady!” Replied Kaidan sternly as he approaches Raine, grabbed her and took a closer look at the hole in Raine’s forehead.

“Tch, then help me clean up the place and scoop up the black soil. I would like to keep my insides where they belong, by being actually inside of me.” Tsked Raine as she tries to wiggle out of Kaidan’s grip.

“Hmmm, did you realize that roots are coming down from the top of the inside of your skull? It’s fascinating, where there should be a brain there is a network of roots instead. And some are even exposed to the air, and some are severed and broken yet you are still talking smack to me so you should be fine.” Asked Kaidan as he commented on Raine’s state of health.

“Yeah, I breathe through my leaves. I don’t have lungs you know, and it’s still fine to have the roots exposed and severed as they can grow back as long as I fill the space with the black soil again for them to recover. At least I hope they do.” Answered Raine as she stays still, giving up on the struggle as she doesn’t want to hurt Kaidan with her enhanced strength while struggling.

“You hope? That means you don’t know how your own body function?” Asked Kaidan incredulously.

“When I found a manual for this body I would let you know. Now could you let go of me and call Ron and the others? While I may have given up going to the mech match today, I still have an appointment with Miss Iden to crack open a frigate you know?” Said Raine with resignation.

Kaidan let go of Raine immediately and decided to scoop up the black soil scattered on the floor from the assassination attempt. With a handful of black soils in his hand, he approached Raine and pour it into the cavity manually.

Raine decided to help Kaidan as well, but when she bent over to do the scooping up, the black soil decided to spill over to the floor again.

“I believe it would be prudent for you to take a seat on the sofa and wait for me to fill in the cavity for you Ms. Raine.” Said Kaidan with a mild statement, much to Raine’s disappointment.

Raine returns to the sofa before sitting there and sulking in disappointment as she watch Kaidan gather all the black soil in his pockets.

Once Kaidan is sure that he did not miss any of the soil and avoiding most of the broken fragment of glass to the best of his ability, he sealed his pockets to make sure none of the black soils drop to the ground.

“Well, Ms. Raine looks like that’s everything. Now we could follow your advice on calling Ron and everyone else here, but I think it would be better if we immediately leave the Garden together after meeting up with them in the parking lot. That way we don’t have to take two trips going back and forth.” Offered Kaidan as he approached the sulking Raine, sitting on the sofa.

Raine look at Kaidan with an ‘Are you an idiot face?’ while pointing at the hole in her head.

“Oh come on, I am sure the guy who owns this office have something we could use.” Said Kaidan as he walks to the office desk and starts opening the cabinet one by one before exclaiming in joy.

“Oh! I found the perfect thing for you to use!” Said Kaidan happily as he shows a hat to Raine, who take a look at the hat before coldly refusing Kaidan.

“No, there is no way you could make me wear that hat.” Refused Raine coldly as she imagines throttling Kaidan's neck.

“Oh come on, the faster you agree, the faster we could go home?” Begged Kaidan as he approached Raine and offered the hat on his hand.

“What is in it for me?” Asked Raine as she still considers the pro and con of wearing the hat.

“I’d play the console game with you for an hour?” Offered Kaidan hopefully.

“Make it three hours, and we have a deal.” Counter offered Raine.

“Deal, now quickly wear the hat, and I would make a call to Ron so we could meet up in the parking lot.” Sighed Kaidan with relief, wasting three hours playing games would be a small price to pay if he could bring Raine to Commander Iden without any issue.

Raine swiped the damn hat from Kaidan’s hand before glaring at the offensive thing with malice.

“Oh God, the irony of wearing the hat when I was a man in my last life and the fact that I am now a Dryad is not lost on me. I just have one question. WHY?!” Lamented Raine who recently felt that her whole life is just a string of tragedy masquerading as comedy.

“Now, now a deal’s a deal. Don't back out on me now.” Said Kaidan as he tries hard to suppress a laugh.

“I’ll remember that when I ask you to play the game with me if you ever said you are busy at the moment.” Said Raine coldly as she wears the hat to cover up the hole on her forehead from other people's view.

“Meh, it’s a problem for future me to sort out. Anyway, I have contacted Ron and the others when you are glaring at the hat forlornly. Wear the hat and let’s go already.” Said Kaidan positively.

“Fine, let’s get it over with.” Said Raine with resignation as she wore the damned hat.

“Oooh, surprisingly adorable and cute. I am glad I am recording this in my helmet now.” Said Kaidan happily.

Raine is about to curse Kaidan before she realizes a critical point in Kaidan’s words.

“Kaidan! You are an idiot! If you have a recording device in your helmet, you could have recorded the guy who did this whole thing as well!” Scolded Raine angrily.

Kaidan was at a loss for a moment before he slapped his head in realization.

“Oh yeah! I do have the recording in my helmet. Thanks for reminding me Ms. Raine, the best part of all is that my helmet recorded the image of a whole day before being backed up to the server in the Normandy Mk.II. So we definitely have proof of the Gallente Federation Commando involvement in the Garden's terrorist incident.” Said Kaidan with wonder at himself for failing to remember the camera in his helmet.

“So you are saying that you did not, in fact, missed the chance to record the evidence of the guy who did this to my head?” Asked Raine tensely to confirm the recording's existence.

“Yes, I have it all in my helmet.” Confirmed Kaidan lightly as he tapped the side of his helmet.

“You have just escaped a terrible fate, and I hope you realize that if you did not record it, I would impose on you a torture that I am now just realizing no longer subjected to.” Said Raine with an evil grin.

“Yeah? What’s that?” Gulped Kaidan with fear and trepidation from seeing Raine's evil grin.

“A kick to the balls.” Answered Raine bluntly.

“Oh, you evil evil girl you!” Shrieked Kaidan as he goes pale with Raine’s threat to kick his balls.

“Silence minion, your princess demands that you carry her to her carriage.” Said Raine in mock seriousness as she offered her hand while looking away like a stereotypical princess.

“Seriously? I always thought it was supposed to be the princess which carry the guy and fight for his honor.” Commented Kaidan with confusion.

“... I bet Disney would be rolling in their grave right about now.” Remarked Raine in humor before jumping onto Kaidan’s back and holding on for dear life.

“Argh, careful with where you’re touching. I just clean the blood of my gear this morning, and I don’t want you to smudge it already.” Complained Kaidan even as he holds Raine’s leg in place.

“Nope, I am blocking what this hat said with your head. So if you would be so kind start walking minion.” Said Raine as she milked her childish appearance for all her worth.

“Sigh, the things I do for a paycheck.” Said Kaidan with resignation as he gets ready to carry Raine to the car.

Raine smirked at Kaidan’s reluctance yet resigning himself to carry her to the car. She could get used to being a small child if people keep entertaining what she wants and ignore her selfishness. She hums happily while being carried by Kaidan, that is, until she hit her head hard on the top rail of the door frame.

“Oh my Gosh Ms. Raine I am sorry.” Said Kaidan as he sincerely apologized for causing Raine another injury on top of the horrible wound in her head.

Raine hissed in pain. Honestly, she has no idea why bumping her head is more painful than having a bullet pierce through it.

“Never mind, I see karma is still a bitch. At least that is something that remains the same from my time.” Said Raine with a small whimper as she rubbed her hand over her forehead.

Thankfully that was the last hiccup that Raine experienced while in the Garden. The trip to the carpark was smooth, as the security personnel and droids allow both Kaidan and her, passage through the security blockage due to his status as an adamantine ranked Mercenary team.

Once both of them have exit the Garden building and appropriating an Aerial platform, Raine found herself whooping once again during their flight on the aerial platform from the Garden entrance to the ground level parking lot. She was disappointed that the aerial ride was over, but it is balanced by the fact that she is about to leave this place for good.

Before she knows it, after leaving the aerial platform and a short distance walking from the station, both Kaidan and her have arrived at the car where Ron, Tanya, Master Yu, and Mi are already waiting.

“There she is, our little firecracker! I have no idea how you did it, but the scene at the Guild Office would surely become an urban legend among the Garden’s Student Cadets. You may have made yourself a part of one of the seven mysteries of the Garden from what I have heard.” Said Ron with a teasing undertone when he sees Kaidan and Ron close approaching.

“Oh put a sock in your mouth Ron. I could have used the backup. How could you leave me behind? I thought we’re BFF’s.” Said Raine in mock sadness as she pulls back her arm to punch Ron in playfulness.

“Whoa! Easy there! I don’t plan on flying without an aerial platform after I just spent the time riding one to get here.” Said Ron with a protest as he raised both hands in surrender.

“Oh you’re right, sorry I’m new to this super strength thing.” Acknowledged Raine of Ron’s fear and concern of being hit by the equivalent of a truck speeding at 80km/hour.

“Miss Raine, I am sorry about the commotion during your time in the Garden. Usually, they limit themselves to brawling with fellow mercenary instead of an obviously still minor guest.” Apologized Master Yu in shame.

“I can’t believe you did not realize why. Did you not see the way Raine punched the ass flying into the distance?” Said Ron dubiously, which made everyone just stared at Ron awkwardly while the blind Master Yu deliberately cough.

“Oh, right. Forget I said anything.” Said Ron in shame.

“Anyway, it’s about time we leave this place. Sad to say I won’t miss this place, but sorry being a mercenary is not my thing you know?” Said Raine lightly trying to move on from Ron’s obliviousness.

So Raine hops onto one of the car, followed by Kaidan in the driver seat beside her. Curiously, Ron took the driver seat on the other car yet Tanya still stay beside Master Yu and Mi.

“Tanya? Aren’t you coming?” Asked Raine with curiosity.

“No, I am a student cadet in the Garden now. So I have to stay behind actually to enroll in their program.” Admitted Tanya, the reason she stays silent is because she is sad that it is time for them to go their separate ways.

“Your friend is in good hands, Ms. Raine.” Said the blind Master Yu as she kindly put both hands on Tanya’s shoulder while Mi just grunted neither agreeing or disagreeing.

Raine became sad after hearing Tanya’s answer, yet she did realize that this is what Tanya want and need. So who was she to stop her from following her dream?

“Is that so? Alright, I changed my mind. Now I am sad to leave this place.” Said Raine as she exits the car again and stands while facing Tanya, Master Yu and Mi.

“It won’t be so bad, you could visit me when you are at the station, and besides we just met yesterday, but I feel that you have already done so much for me. This time I will study to make something out of myself, and maybe I will be a help to you in the future when I graduated as a mercenary.” Said Tanya while looking lonely and feeling abandoned.

“Sigh, open the trunk Ron.” Said Raine as she walk to the other car driven by Ron and open the car trunk.

Raine is rummaging through the junk and random items before she found her gears stored in Ron's car trunk on their way to the Garden. Holding the pile of drop suit armour, helmet, nova knifes and Car-9 Scrambler pistol on both hands, she closed the car trunk with her elbow before she walks to where Tanya, Master Yu and Mi are standing. She then dropped all the things she is carrying on the ground before she bent down and pick the Car-9 Scrambler Pistols as well as the three spare ammunition cartridges from the pile.

“Here Tanya, take the Amarrian Scrambler Pistol. Something to remember me by while you are here.” Offered Raine as she extend her hand holding the Car-9 Scrambler pistol and the corresponding ammunition cartridges.

Tanya accepted the sidearms firmly and finally smiled at Raine’s farewell gift.

“Besides maybe by the time you graduated and became a Mercenary, I would be a successful trader or merchant by then. I could even hire you as a personal bodyguard. Heaven knows I need someone to watch over me sometimes, and I don’t want these two goons following me to the bathroom now, never mind having to tolerate it until you graduated.” Explained Raine mildly as she pointed a thumb at Kaidan.

"I resent that." Complained Kaidan while mumbling under his breath.

“I will treasure the gift, and would remember your offer… Senpai.” Said Tanya as she gripped the Car-9 Scrambler Pistol tightly while ignoring Kaidan's grumbling.

“Well, it has been fun meeting you I suppose, see you next time I’m at this station then.” Said Raine as she picked up her gears and return to Kaidan’s car.

Raine sits on the passenger side and holds her things with one hand before she used the free hand to equip the seatbelt.

Kaidan felt at that point that it is a good time to turn on the vehicle and leave the Garden proper, with Ron following suit.

Raine waved goodbye at Tanya and her entourage, in which they waved goodbye in return before they left the Garden entrance gate behind and entered the highway.

“If you miss her so much we could cancel Tanya's Garden enrolment and bring her with us instead Miss Raine.” Offered Kaidan, as he try to be supportive of Raine's feeling.

“No, it is something she decided to do. I won’t force her to follow us. Besides, it's a small universe. Who knows we may meet again down the road sooner than we think.” Declined Raine with a bit of leftover sadness and an undertone of hope clouding her mind as she fiddled with her gears on her lap.

“Words to live by Ms. Raine.” Praised Kaidan as he watch Raine stares at the Garden getting smaller before disappearing altogether in the distance.

"Oh shit, I forgot the Scrambler Pistol I gave Tanya is jammed because I forcibly shoot it from within a giant slime! I gave Tanya a broken sidearm as a gift!" Said Raine in horror as she whiped her head back to the Garden.

"Whelp, its's their problem now, but not to worry Ms. Raine the Garden's weapon technicians are quite capable. I am sure they can resolve whatever problem the Scrambler Pistol may have." Remarked Kaidan reassuringly.

Raine sighed, cursed, and complained all the way until they met up with Iden, much to Kaidan's suffering.
